```{python}
import pandas as pd
import plotly.io as pio
import plotly.express as px


rows = [
    {
        "Language":"Machine language",
        "Year":1945,
        "Authors":"(no single author)",
        "Purpose":"Created as the binary instructions that a computer executes directly.",
        "currentUse":"Still the final form that all programs become after compilation."
    },
    {
        "Language":"Assembly Language",
        "Year":1951,
        "Authors":"Early computer scientists",
        "Purpose":"Developed to replace raw binary with human-readable mnemonics for hardware instructions.",
        "currentUse":"Embedded Systems (microcontrollers in medical devices and wearables), video/audio codecs, cybersecurity."
    },
        {
        "Language":"FORTRAN",
        "Year":1957,
        "Authors":"John Backus (IBM)",
        "Purpose":"Designed to allow scientists to write mathematical formulas in a readable programming form.",
        "currentUse":"Still used in scientific computing and high-performance numerical simulations."
    },
        {
        "Language":"Lisp",
        "Year":1958,
        "Authors":"John McCarthy",
        "Purpose":"Created to support symbolic computation and AI resaearch.",
        "currentUse":"Influences modern functional programming and is still used in AI-related domains."
    },
        {
        "Language":"C",
        "Year":1972,
        "Authors":"Dennis Ritchie",
        "Purpose":"Built to develop the Unix operating system with efficiency and portability.",
        "currentUse":"Widely used in operating systems, embedded systems, and performance-critical software such as operating system kernels (Linux, Windows, MacOS)."
    },
        {
        "Language":"SQL",
        "Year":1974,
        "Authors":"Donald Chamberlin & Raymond Boyce (IBM)",
        "Purpose":"Created to query and manage relational databases using simple, structured commands.",
        "currentUse":"The standard language for business databases, analytics, and backend data systems."
    },
        {
        "Language":"C++",
        "Year":1979,
        "Authors":"Bjarne Stroustrup",
        "Purpose":"Developed to extend C with object-oriented programming features while maintaining speed.",
        "currentUse":"Widely used in game development, finance, real-time systems, and high-performance applications like the rendering engine of Google Chrome and Safari."
    },
        {
        "Language":"Python",
        "Year":1991,
        "Authors":"Guido van Rossum",
        "Purpose":"Designed to emphasize readability and programmer productivity.",
        "currentUse":"Extremely popular in automation, data science, education, and web development."
    },
        {
        "Language":"R",
        "Year":1993,
        "Authors":"Ross Ihaka & Robert Gentleman",
        "Purpose":"Created specifically for statistical computing and data visualization.",
        "currentUse":"Widely used in research, academia, and applied data analysis."
    },
        {
        "Language":"Julia",
        "Year":2012,
        "Authors":"Jeff Bezanson, Stefan Karpinski, Viral Shah, Alan Edelman",
        "Purpose":"Developed to combine high-level syntax with high-performance scientific computing.",
        "currentUse":"Growing in scientific research, machine learning, and numerical modeling."
    },
]

df = pd.DataFrame(rows).sort_values("Year")
df

fig = px.scatter(
    df,
    x="Year",
    y="Language",
    hover_data=["Authors", "Purpose", "currentUse"],
    title="Interactive Timeline of Programming Languages"
)
fig.update_traces(marker=dict(size=12))
fig.update_layout(xaxis=dict(dtick=10))

fig
```
